props.name: Parameter_Description
props.value: This variable is the setting for the -f option in Audit configuration which sets the failure mode of audit. This option lets you determine how you want the kernel to handle critical errors. Possible values are: 0=silent, 1=printk, 2=panic. If the value is set to "2", the system is configured to panic (shut down) in the event of an auditing failure. If the value is set to "1", the system is configured to only send information to the kernel log regarding the failure.

props.value: This variable is the setting for the -f option in Audit configuration which sets the failure mode of audit. This option lets you determine how you want the kernel to handle critical errors. Possible values are: 0=silent, 1=printk, 2=panic. If the value is set to "2", the system is configured to panic (shut down) in the event of an auditing failure. If the value is set to "1", the system is configured to only send information to the kernel log regarding the failure.

If the value is set to "2", the system is configured to panic (shut down) in the event of an auditing failure. If the value is set to "1", the system is configured to only send information to the kernel log regarding the failure.

props.value: This variable is the setting for the -f option in Audit configuration which sets the failure mode of audit. This option lets you determine how you want the kernel to handle critical errors. Possible values are: 0=silent, 1=printk, 2=panic. If the value is set to "2", the system is configured to panic (shut down) in the event of an auditing failure. If the value is set to "1", the system is configured to only send information to the kernel log regarding the failure.

props.name: Parameter_Description
props.value: This variable is the setting for the -f option in Audit configuration which sets the failure mode of audit. This option lets you determine how you want the kernel to handle critical errors. Possible values are: 0=silent, 1=printk, 2=panic. If the value is set to "2", the system is configured to panic (shut down) in the event of an auditing failure. If the value is set to "1", the system is configured to only send information to the kernel log regarding the failure.

This option lets you determine how you want the kernel to handle critical errors. Possible values are: 0=silent, 1=printk, 2=panic. If the value is set to "2", the system is configured to panic (shut down) in the event of an auditing failure. If the value is set to "1", the system is configured to only send information to the kernel log regarding the failure.

props.name: Parameter_Description
props.value: Specify the authselect profile to select

props.name: Parameter_Description
props.value:
Type of policy in use. Possible values are:
targeted - Only targeted network daemons are protected.
strict - Full SELinux protection.
mls - Multiple levels of security

props.name: Parameter_Description
props.value:
enforcing - SELinux security policy is enforced.
permissive - SELinux prints warnings instead of enforcing.
disabled - SELinux is fully disabled.

props.value: Specify the maximum number of idle message counts before session is terminated.
